abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Assam Agricultural
            Competitiveness Project for India were as follows: outcomes
            were satisfactory, risk to development outcome was low, Bank
            performance was satisfactory, and Borrower performance was
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: identifying the
            most important constraints and addressing them through
            well-tested simple technical solutions proved to be the key
            factor for project success. Strong, high-level political
            commitment on the part of the Government of Assam was
            instrumental to the success of the project. Implementing
            project activities through government agencies can advance
            major policy reforms and mainstream innovations within and
            throughout public sector institutions. The innovative
            community procurement model was a key factor contributing to
            the success of the project. Agricultural technology
            management agency (ATMA) has proven an effective model for
            developing and disseminating new agricultural technologies
            but now its role should be extended to promoting value chain
            development activities. Comprehensive groundwater monitoring
            system is an important policy tool for environmental and
            economic management of irrigation systems.

abstracts.cdata!:
In the light of the prevailing country
            practices and conditions and with the objective of aligning
            better with the country systems, there will be an extension
            of the timeline of the submission of the audits in the India
            portfolio from six to nine months for all active projects,
            starting with audit report due for FY2015. All future
            projects will continue to use the flexibility provided by
            OP/BO 10.00 in terms of determining the timing of the audit.
            This proposal to extend the date of submission of annual
            audit reports to nine months across the active India
            portfolio is being processed in response to India’s request
            dated 21-January-2015.
